data.text:
THE GIRLS OF A HARD DAY’S NIGHT

Highlighting the uncredited lucky girls with bit parts in the Beatles’ first film!

* * * *

SUSAN WHITMAN

Susan Whitman, born in 1946, was a 17 year-old acting student at the Aida Foster school in London when she was cast as a schoolgirl in A Hard Day's Night. Her scenes included the train compartment scene when John pretends to be a prisoner, and the baggage car scene when the Beatles sing "I Should Have Known Better". Sue is the one who reaches through the baggage cage trying to touch Ringo's hair. But it was John Lennon who was her favorite Beatle and Sue was chosen to pose for publicity photos combing John's hair on the film set. Adding to her once-in-lifetime experience Sue's good friend, Tina Williams - also from the Aida Foster school, was hired to portray a schoolgirl.

Susan Whitman did some modelling during the sixties and has several acting roles to her credit posted on her IMDb page including the television series Crossroads and the 1964 film Smashing Time. She made four appearances on the series Z Cars in 1967-68, but her last acting credit was for the portrayal of a nurse in A Nice Girl Like Me in 1969.

A news article linked to Susan Whitman's IMDb page in 2009 titled: The Decision To Give Life, When Life Has Passed On - features an interview with Susan and a photo with her husband. Susan's husband, Joseph Helfgot, finally got the heart transplant surgery he'd waited a year for, but tragically he did not survive the surgery. Susan bravely made the decision to donate her husband's face to a man who'd been suffering after an industrial accident. The link to the full article is available at Susan Whitman's IMDb page.
